result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald Wesley King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald Wesley King

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donald Wesley King in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.
ADA Marcoux proposes DEF will plead guilty to Count # 2 and Count # 1 will be dismissed, but read-in, fine of $ 100.00 plus costs for a total of $ 579. 3 pts-license.
Court addresses DEF and Atty Duffy. DEF has gone over plea queationaire with Atty Duffy and signed. DEF pleads guilty to Count # 2.
ADA Marcoux argues for disposition-Mr King has personally apologized to officer involved. Some priors, but back in '90s.
Atty Duffy asks joint recommendation be followed.
Court accepts DEF's plea and finds DEF guilty. Imposes fine of $ 100.00 plus costs totaling $ 579.00, given 60 days to pay or set up payment plan. 3pts-license.

Defendant Donald Wesley King in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.   DEF temporarily waives his rights to attorney to speak to DA office to try to resolve matter.   Court enters NG Plea.   SISB $500     Absolute Sobriety  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 11:00 am.
